dcm.query module#

Provides an abstraction around the DICOM query model and data hierarchy

Exceptions:

InconsistentDataError

The data set violates the established patient/study/series heirarchy

InsufficientQueryLevelError

Can't perform operation due to the query level being too shallow

InvalidDicomError

A DICOM dataset is invalid

QueryLevelMismatchError

Query levels differ and they need to be the same for this operation

Classes:

DataNode

Identifies a node in the DICOM data hierarchy

DataPath

Identifies the path to a node in the DICOM data hierarchy

QueryLevel

Represents the depth for a query, with larger values meaning more detail

QueryProv

Track how a QueryResult was created

QueryResult

High level representation of a collection of DICOM data sets

Functions:

choose_level(qdat[, default])

Try to choose the correct level for a given query

get_all_uids(data_set)

get_subcount_attr(data_level, count_level)

get_uid(level, data_set)

Get the UID from the data_set for the given level

info_to_dataset(level, info)

Turn normalized info dict back into DICOM data set

minimal_copy(ds)

Make reduced copy with only the attributes needed for a QueryResult

Data:

blankable_req_elems

Some 'required' attributes can be blank, treat missing values as blank in this case

level_filters

Element filters for each level

level_identifiers

Maps query levels to elements that imply that level is needed

opt_elems

Optional attributes we always try to query (exclusive to each level)

req_elems

Required attributes for each query level (accumulates at each level)

uid_elems

Map QueryLevels to the DICOM keyword that gives the corresponding UID
exception dcm.query.InconsistentDataError#

Bases: DicomDataError

The data set violates the established patient/study/series heirarchy

exception dcm.query.InsufficientQueryLevelError#

Bases: Exception

Can’t perform operation due to the query level being too shallow

exception dcm.query.InvalidDicomError#

Bases: DicomDataError

A DICOM dataset is invalid

exception dcm.query.QueryLevelMismatchError#

Bases: Exception

Query levels differ and they need to be the same for this operation

class dcm.query.QueryLevel#

Bases: IntEnum

Represents the depth for a query, with larger values meaning more detail

Attributes:

IMAGE

PATIENT

SERIES

STUDY

IMAGE = 3#
PATIENT = 0#
SERIES = 2#
STUDY = 1#
class dcm.query.QueryProv#

Bases: object

Track how a QueryResult was created

Allows consumers to avoid duplicate work, and users can avoid repeating themselves when chaining operations

Methods:

__init__([source, queried_elems, ...])

from_json_dict(json_dict)

merged(other, keep_attrs)

to_json_dict()

Attributes:

queried_elems

The attributes that were queried for

removed_existing_on

A remote we queried and removed any data that already exists on it

source

The source of this query result

class dcm.query.QueryResult#

Bases: object

High level representation of a collection of DICOM data sets

Object is both set-like as it is a set of unique DICOM datasets, and also tree-like as these data sets describe a patient/study/series/image hierarchy.

Parameters:

  • level – The max level in the hierarchy we have data for

  • data_sets – Initial DICOM datasets to add to the result

  • prov – Optional provenance information about how this QueryResult was built

Methods:

__init__(level[, data_sets, prov])

add(data_set)

Add a data set to the query result

children([node])

Generate child nodes of the given one

clear()

Clear all contained data sets

equivalent(other)

Slightly looser equality testing allows different levels

from_json_dict(json_dict)

Create a QueryResult from a previous to_json call

get_count(level[, node])

Get number of nodes at the level in the subtree under node

get_path(node)

Get path to the node in hierarchy

instances([series_uid])

Generates InstanceUIDs for this query result, or a specific series

level_paths(level)

Generate all paths at the given level

level_sub_queries(level)

n_instances([node])

Number of instances in the data

n_patients()

Number of patients in the data

n_series([node])

Number of series in the data

n_studies([node])

Number of studies in the data

node_info(node)

Get meta data specific to this node in the hierarchy

path_data_set(data_path)

Get a DICOM data set containing the meta data for the data_path

path_info(data_path)

Get all meta data along a path through the hierarchy

patients()

Genarates all PatientID values in this query result

reduced(level)

Create lower level of detail copy

remove(data_set)

Remove a single data set

series([study_uid])

Genarates SeriesUIDs in this query result, or for a specific study

studies([patient_id])

Genarates StudyUIDs in this query result, or for a specific patient

sub(other[, ignore_subcounts])

Take the difference between two QueryResutls, with options

sub_query(node[, max_level])

Get a subset as its own QueryResult

to_json_dict()

Dump a JSON representation of the heirarchy

to_line([node, level_fmts, sep, missing])

Get line of text describing a single node

to_tree([max_level, level_fmts, sep, missing])

Produce a formatted text tree representation

uids()

Generates the UIDs for each contained data set

walk([start_node])

Generator that traverses the hierarchy in depth-first order

None

equivalent(other)#

Slightly looser equality testing allows different levels

Provided the lower level QueryResult has sub-counts that match the higher level one, they are considered equivalent

Parameters:

other (QueryResult) –

Return type:

bool

walk(start_node=None)#

Generator that traverses the hierarchy in depth-first order

Parameters:

start_node (Optional[DataNode]) – Limit the traversal to the subtree rooted here

Returns:

  • curr_path – Identifies the current traversal path

  • sub_uids – List of uids for child nodes, can be trimmed to avoid traversing

Return type:

Iterator[Tuple[DataPath, List[str]]]

dcm.query.blankable_req_elems = ['PatientID', 'PatientName', 'StudyDate', 'StudyTime', 'SeriesNumber', 'InstanceNumber']#

Some ‘required’ attributes can be blank, treat missing values as blank in this case

dcm.query.level_filters = {QueryLevel.PATIENT: <function make_elem_filter.<locals>.filt>, QueryLevel.STUDY: <function make_elem_filter.<locals>.filt>, QueryLevel.SERIES: <function make_elem_filter.<locals>.filt>, QueryLevel.IMAGE: <function make_elem_filter.<locals>.filt>}#

Element filters for each level

dcm.query.level_identifiers = {QueryLevel.PATIENT: ['NumberOfPatientRelatedStudies', 'NumberOfPatientRelatedSeries', 'NumberOfPatientRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.STUDY: ['StudyInstanceUID', 'StudyDate', 'StudyTime', 'NumberOfStudyRelatedSeries', 'NumberOfStudyRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.SERIES: ['SeriesInstanceUID', 'SeriesNumber', 'Modality', 'SeriesDescription', 'ProtocolName', 'NumberOfSeriesRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.IMAGE: ['SOPInstanceUID', 'InstanceNumber']}#

Maps query levels to elements that imply that level is needed

dcm.query.opt_elems: Dict[QueryLevel, List[str]] = {QueryLevel.PATIENT: ['NumberOfPatientRelatedStudies', 'NumberOfPatientRelatedSeries', 'NumberOfPatientRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.STUDY: ['StudyDescription', 'AccessionNumber', 'ModalitiesInStudy', 'NumberOfStudyRelatedSeries', 'NumberOfStudyRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.SERIES: ['SeriesDescription', 'ProtocolName', 'NumberOfSeriesRelatedInstances'], QueryLevel.IMAGE: []}#

Optional attributes we always try to query (exclusive to each level)

dcm.query.req_elems = {QueryLevel.PATIENT: ['PatientID', 'PatientName'], QueryLevel.STUDY: ['StudyInstanceUID', 'StudyDate', 'StudyTime'], QueryLevel.SERIES: ['SeriesInstanceUID', 'SeriesNumber', 'Modality'], QueryLevel.IMAGE: ['SOPInstanceUID', 'InstanceNumber']}#

Required attributes for each query level (accumulates at each level)

dcm.query.uid_elems = {QueryLevel.PATIENT: 'PatientID', QueryLevel.STUDY: 'StudyInstanceUID', QueryLevel.SERIES: 'SeriesInstanceUID', QueryLevel.IMAGE: 'SOPInstanceUID'}#

Map QueryLevels to the DICOM keyword that gives the corresponding UID
